subject: Creativity
title: Laughter as Protest: How Comedy Fights Power
description: A quick, practical guide to Laughter as Protest: How Comedy Fights Power.

hook.text: During the Prague Spring, Czechs told jokes about Soviet tanks. The KGB banned humor magazines first.

buildup.text: Throughout history, comedians have been among the first targets of authoritarian regimes.

discovery.text: Humor works as protest because it reframes power. A dictator mocked is a dictator diminished.

twist.text: Satirists like Jon Stewart shifted US political opinion more than news anchors, studies show.

climax.text: Comedy protests work because laughter is involuntary. You can ban a speech but you can't un-laugh a joke.

punchline.text: The pen is mighty. The punchline is mightier.

quiz.question: Why is comedy effective as a form of protest?
options: It reframes power and laughter is involuntary
